help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr1: Note: After you have made your changes, click Save Settings to apply your changes.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr5: If this Router shares your Internet connection for your local network, keep the default, Enabled.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr8: When NAT is disabled, this option is available. It allows the Router to automatically exchange routing tables with other router(s).
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr11: To set up a static route between the Router and another network, select a number from the drop-down menu. To delete a static route, select its number and click Delete This Entry.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr13: Enter a name for the route.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr15: Enter the IP address of the remote network or host to which you want to assign a static route.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr17: Enter the subnet mask for the Destination LAN IP address.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr19: Enter the IP address of the gateway server that enables communication between the Router and the remote network or host.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr21: Select the location of the Destination LAN IP address.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr22: Click Show Routing Table to view the static routes you have already set up.
help_connectivity_routing.lang_hcr23: Note: For more information, refer to the online User Guide at www.linksys.com.
